wikipedia_page.main: Louis Meredith Dyke (1888 – 12 July 1961) was a Welsh rugby union player who won four international caps at centre for Wales between 1910 and 1911. At club level he played for several clubs, most notably Cardiff and London Welsh.

response: Wales: Jack Bancroft (Swansea), Billy Spiller (Cardiff), Reggie Gibbs (Cardiff) capt., Louis Dyke (Cardiff), Johnnie Williams (Cardiff), Percy Bush (Swansea), Tommy Vile (Newport), Harry Jarman (Newport), Ben Gronow (Bridgend), Ernie Jenkins (Newport), David John Thomas (Swansea), Jim Webb (Abertillery), Tom Evans (Llanelli), Ivor Morgan (Swansea), Joseph Pugsley (Cardiff)

link_mentions.page: List of international rugby union families
